author: Harper Lee
review: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee published in 1960. It was immediately successful, winning the Pulitzer Prize, and has become a classic of modern American literature.

author: George Orwell
review: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell published in 1949. It depicts a totalitarian regime and explores themes of surveillance, propaganda, and control.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: The Great Gatsby is a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald published in 1925. Set in the Roaring Twenties, it explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

author: Jane Austen
review: Pride and Prejudice is a novel by Jane Austen published in 1813. It follows the romantic lives of the Bennett sisters and explores themes of marriage and social status.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J.D. Salinger published in 1951. It follows the experiences of Holden Caulfield, a teenager struggling with identity and adulthood.

author: Herman Melville
review: Moby-Dick is a novel by Herman Melville published in 1851. It tells the story of the sailor Ishmael's voyage aboard the whaling ship Pequod and his obsession with the white whale, Moby Dick.
